title: House for Plants
text:
Only registered TrekEarth members may write critiques. Photographer's Note 
A greenhouse (also called a glasshouse, or, if with additional heating, a hothouse) is a structure with walls and roof made chiefly of transparent material such as glass in which plants requiring regulated climatic conditions are grown. These structures range in size from small sheds to industrial-sized buildings. A miniature greenhouse is known as a cold frame. The interior of a greenhouse exposed to sunlight becomes significantly warmer than the external ambient temperature, protecting its contents in cold weather. Many commercial glass greenhouses or hothouses are high tech production facilities for vegetables or flowers. The glass greenhouses are filled with equipment including screening installations, heating, cooling, lighting, and may be controlled by a computer to optimise conditions for plant growth. source: Wikipedia In world there severel greenhouses that stand out for their structures. Bellow I listed some greenhouses from the world that I belive are the most pretties: RHS Garden Wisley's Greenhouse (UK) New York Botanical Garden's Greenhouse (USA) Laeken's Royal Greenhouses (Belgium) The Royal Botanic Garden of Edinburgh's Greenhouse (UK) Botanical Garden and Botanical Museum of Berlin's Greenhouse (Germany) The Palm House at the Belfast Botanical Garden (Ireland) The Botanical Garden of Copenhagen's Greenhouse (Denmark) Adelaide Botanic Garden's Greenhouse (Australia) Muttart Conservatory's Greenhouse (Canada) Gardens By The Bay'Greenhouse (Singapore), the biggest in the world Lalbagh Botanical Garden's Greenhouse (India) Palace of Cristal - El Retiro Park (Spain), the place now is working as a art gallery If you have photos of this places, please put the link in your critique or commentary.
